intro: Roupala sanctae-catharinae, commonly known as the Santa Catarina roupala, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many diverse and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the understorey of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
